recipes.title: Homemade Doro Wat
recipes.description: Traditional Ethiopian spicy chicken stew, perfect for special occasions and family gatherings.
instructions: Clean the chicken pieces with lemon juice and rinse with cold water.
In a large pot, cook the onions over medium heat until soft and translucent, about 10 minutes. No need to add oil as the onions will release moisture.
Add the garlic and ginger, continue cooking for 5 minutes.
Stir in the berbere spice and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add the niter kibbeh and stir until melted and well combined with the spices.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot, stirring to coat them with the sauce.
Pour in enough water to just cover the chicken, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low.
Simmer covered for about 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the hard-boiled eggs and continue to simmer for another 15-20 minutes until the sauce has thickened.
Adjust seasoning with salt if needed.
Serve hot with injera bread.

comments.text: This recipe is amazing! Just like my grandmother used to make.
Great recipe but I found it a bit too spicy. I'll use less berbere next time.

recipes.title: Authentic Injera
recipes.description: Traditional Ethiopian sourdough flatbread, the foundation of Ethiopian cuisine.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix teff flour with water until you have a smooth, thin batter.
Add the starter culture and mix well.
Cover the bowl with a cloth and let it ferment at room temperature for 3-4 days. The batter will become bubbly and have a sour smell.
Once fermented, add salt and stir.
Heat a non-stick pan or traditional mitad on medium heat.
Pour a thin layer of batter onto the pan in a circular motion, starting from the outside and moving inward.
Cover and cook for about 2-3 minutes until bubbles form on the surface and the edges begin to lift.
Do not flip the injera. It should only be cooked on one side.
Remove from the pan and let cool on a clean cloth.
Repeat with the remaining batter.
Stack the cooled injera and serve with various stews and dishes.

comments.text: Perfect recipe! The fermentation time is key for authentic flavor.
I struggled with getting the right consistency at first, but after a few tries it came out perfect!

recipes.title: Tibs with Vegetables
recipes.description: Sautéed beef with vegetables and aromatic spices, a popular Ethiopian dish.
instructions: Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Add the niter kibbeh and let it melt.
Add the beef cubes and sear on all sides until browned but still pink inside, about 5 minutes.
Remove the beef and set aside.
In the same pan, add the onions and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes.
Add the garlic, jalapeños, and bell peppers, and cook for another 3 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, rosemary, and berbere spice (if using), and cook for 2 minutes.
Return the beef to the pan, season with salt and pepper, and stir to combine.
Cook for another 2-3 minutes until everything is well combined and the beef is cooked to your liking.
Serve hot with injera bread.

comments.text: I love how quick and flavorful this recipe is! Perfect for weeknight dinners.
